title: The Screen writer
creator_credit: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
brief_description: Pictures a typical screen writer and analyses his job. The writer, whether the script is adapted or original, is the starting point for a picture. During actual production the writer often advises actors and director on aspects of production. The film cites some writers who have directed or produced their own scripts and others who are not heads of production at major studios.
